Title: French Soccer Chief Quits Amid Abuse Claims but Pivots to FIFA Post
Description: Noël Le Graët resigned after an investigation found federation staff members had endured sexual and mental abuse, but he will stay in soccer: FIFA has hired him to run its Paris office.

Description: The price of a rolex — eggs rolled up in flatbread — has almost doubled in the last year.

Description: The country’s largest publisher has had a rocky few months since a deal to buy a rival fell through, and some of its top executives left.

Title: Kevin Killed Sydney, and Reddit’s C.E.O. Defends Section 230
Description: And what Meta’s new paid verification program means for the future of social media.

Title: Science Fiction Magazines Battle a Flood of Chatbot-Generated Stories
Description: While the deluge has become a nuisance, the stories are easy to spot. The writing is “bad in spectacular ways,” one editor said.

Title: The CHIPS Act Is About More Than Chips: Here’s What’s in It
Description: A sprawling new program for the semiconductor industry is foremost about national security, but it will try to advance other priorities as well

Title: E.U. Officials Ban TikTok From Employees’ Phones
Description: The European Commission took aim at the popular Chinese-owned app, citing “cybersecurity threats.”

Title: Big Soda’s Alcohol Drinks Worry Health Experts
Description: PepsiCo and Coca-Cola enter hard soda markets, causing concerns among regulators and researchers.

Title: ‘Sometimes Things Break’: Twitter Outages Are on the Rise
Description: Elon Musk’s repeated job cuts are stoking new fears that there aren’t enough people to triage Twitter’s problems.

Title: Why Do A.I. Chatbots Tell Lies and Act Weird? Look in the Mirror.
Description: One of the pioneers of artificial intelligence argues that chatbots are often prodded into producing strange results by the people who are using them.

Title: In Latest Round of Job Cuts, Twitter Is Said to Lay Off at Least 200 Employees
Description: The social media platform now has a work force of less than 2,000, down from 7,500 when Elon Musk took it over in October.

Title: As Oil Companies Stay Lean, Workers Move to Renewable Energy
Description: Solar, wind, geothermal, battery and other alternative-energy businesses are adding workers from fossil fuel companies, where employment has fallen.

Title: Star Banker in China Who Vanished Is Said to Be Aiding Government Inquiry
Description: In a filing on Sunday, China Renaissance Bank said that its C.E.O., Bao Fan, was “cooperating in an investigation” by Chinese authorities.

Title: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie: My Country Is in a Fragile Place
Description: The Biden administration needs to stand behind the Nigerian people now and make a firm commitment to support election transparency.

Title: After Half a Century, ‘The Dark Side of the Moon’ Still Reverberates
Description: Pink Floyd’s enduring blockbuster merged grandeur and malaise. Very much a product of its era, it became one of the best-selling albums of all time.

Title: King Charles’s Role in Northern Ireland Deal Raises Eyebrows
Description: The king’s tie-in to a divisive Brexit-related trade issue drew angry recriminations from critics who viewed it as an improper foray into British politics.

Title: Biden Nominates Julie Su as U.S. Labor Secretary
Description: President Biden’s choice to lead the Labor Department is the deputy to the incumbent, Martin J. Walsh, who is leaving the administration.

Title: ‘Fall River Fishing’ Review: So She Dated an Axe Murderer
Description: A casually absurd play about the infamous Lizzie Borden, presented by Bedlam, cleverly undercuts the central dramatic event.

Description: A breakdown of what’s known, and what’s not, about the incident and its aftermath.

Title: We’ve Been Talking About the Lab-Leak Hypothesis All Wrong
Description: When are we going to get more serious about the highest-security labs?

Description: Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.
